facts: A recording studio uses special soundproofing and soft materials to reduce echoes and keep outside noise from getting into recordings.
Studios often have two main rooms, a live room where musicians play and a control room where engineers listen and adjust the sound.
Microphones change sound waves in the air into electrical signals that can be recorded and edited on computers.
Mixing is the process of balancing the volume and tone of different instruments and voices so they sound good together.
Many studios use a click track, which is a steady beat in headphones that helps musicians stay in time while recording.
A vocal booth is a small room built to isolate a singerâ€™s voice so it can be recorded clearly without other sounds.
Mastering is a final step that makes a finished song sound consistent in volume and quality on different speakers and headphones.
